result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Betts

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Status Report
Initial Scheduling Order
Calendar call on January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:02 AM Defendant Michael Betts appeared by phone. Attorney Kelly James Mattingly appeared by video for Michael Betts. Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney stands mute; Court enters  not guilty plea and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:05 PM Defendant Michael Betts appeared by phone.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly appeared by video for Michael Betts.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom, waiving time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Original warrant returned 9/8/2022
No contact directly or indirectly with victim Christopher Combs, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No possession of dangerous weapons.

2:01 PM Defendant Michael Betts appeared by phone.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly appeared by video for Michael Betts.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Previous bond reinstated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
BPD

Activity:  Non-appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:53 PM   Defendant Michael Betts not in court.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly appeared by video for Michael Betts.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. Cash bond of $500 set.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Kelly Mattingly
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:48 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Betts appeared by video. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $3000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim Christopher Combs, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No possession of dangerous weapons. Defendant to sign bond between August 16, 2022 and August 19, 2022. Defendant to contact Public Defenders Office. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 1:00pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim Christopher Combs, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No possession of dangerous weapons.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
